intro: Phacopsis, commonly known as the "false hellebore," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and alternate, ovate to lanceolate leaves. The flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically greenish or reddish in color. Phacopsis species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. They play a role in soil stabilization and provide habitat for various insect species.
